alert.note: Alert for Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion and southeastern Putnam Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Delancy, or 9 miles northwest of Salt Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph, pea size hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Pomona Park, Lake Delancy, Fruitland, San Mateo, Satsuma, Welaka, Hog Valley and Lake Como. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
